jwst.name: JWST
jwst.description: Most powerful infrared space telescope, studying early universe, galaxy formation, and exoplanet atmospheres

hubble.name: Hubble Space Telescope
hubble.description: Revolutionary space telescope providing deep field images and transforming our understanding of the universe

chandra.name: Chandra X-ray Observatory
chandra.description: Premier X-ray telescope studying black holes, supernovae, galaxy clusters, and high-energy phenomena

spitzer.name: Spitzer Space Telescope
spitzer.description: Infrared telescope that studied star formation, exoplanets, and distant galaxies

kepler.name: Kepler Space Telescope
kepler.description: Exoplanet hunter that discovered thousands of planets using transit photometry

tess.name: TESS
tess.description: All-sky exoplanet survey mission finding planets around nearby bright stars

gaia.name: Gaia
gaia.description: Creates 3D map of our galaxy, measuring positions, distances, and motions of over a billion stars

euclid.name: Euclid
euclid.description: ESA mission mapping dark matter and dark energy across cosmic history

roman.name: Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope
roman.description: Wide-field survey telescope for dark energy, exoplanets, and infrared astrophysics

csst.name: CSST
csst.description: 2-meter Chinese space telescope with Hubble-class resolution surveying 40% of sky for cosmology and galaxy evolution

alma.name: ALMA
alma.description: World's most powerful millimeter/submillimeter observatory studying star/planet formation and distant galaxies

vla.name: VLA
aliases: Karl G. Jansky Very Large Array
vla.description: 27-antenna radio telescope array studying radio emission from celestial objects

ska.name: SKA
ska.description: Next-generation radio telescope array with unprecedented sensitivity and survey speed

sdss.name: SDSS
sdss.description: Major spectroscopic survey creating detailed 3D maps of the universe

lsst.name: LSST
aliases: Legacy Survey of Space and Time
lsst.description: Wide-field survey telescope that will image the entire visible sky every few nights

jwstmiri.name: MIRI
jwstmiri.description: JWST's mid-infrared camera and spectrograph for studying cool objects and dust

jwstnirspec.name: NIRSpec
jwstnirspec.description: JWST's multi-object spectrograph for studying distant galaxies and exoplanet atmospheres

jwstnircam.name: NIRCam
jwstnircam.description: JWST's primary infrared imager and wavefront sensor

illustris_tng.name: IllustrisTNG
illustris_tng.included_physics: gravity, magneto-hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
illustris_tng.description: A suite of large-scale magneto-hydrodynamical simulations of galaxy formation at three volumes (50–300 Mpc on a side).

illustris_original.name: Illustris
illustris_original.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
illustris_original.description: Predecessor to IllustrisTNG, a landmark hydrodynamical simulation of galaxy formation in a ~100 Mpc box.

eagle.name: EAGLE
aliases: Evolution and Assembly of GaLaxies and their Environments
eagle.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, thermal AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
eagle.volume: Boxes from (25 Mpc)^3 up to (100 Mpc)^3
eagle.mass_resolution: 100 Mpc run: Gas 1.81e6 M⊙, DM 9.70e6 M⊙; higher resolution 25 Mpc run: Gas ~2.3e5 M⊙, DM ~1.2e6 M⊙
eagle.description: A suite of hydrodynamical simulations calibrated to match the local galaxy population, spanning volumes 25–100 Mpc on a side.

millennium.name: Millennium Simulation
millennium.description: A foundational, large-scale dark matter-only N-body simulation that traced the evolution of over 10 billion particles in a 500h^-1 Mpc box.

bolshoi.name: Bolshoi Simulation
bolshoi.description: A high-resolution dark matter-only simulation (250h^-1 Mpc cube) used for creating detailed halo catalogs and merger trees.

simba.name: SIMBA
simba.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN jet feedback, black hole growth, dust, chemical enrichment
simba.description: A hydrodynamical simulation (100h^-1 Mpc box) focusing on the co-evolution of galaxies and supermassive black holes, with novel jet feedback implementation.

flares.name: FLARES
aliases: First Light And Reionisation Epoch Simulations
flares.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
flares.volume: Effective aggregate volume ≈ (3.2 Gpc)^3 (from zoom regions drawn from a (3.2 cGpc)^3 parent volume)
flares.mass_resolution: Gas 1.8e6 M⊙, DM 9.7e6 M⊙ (comparable to EAGLE high-resolution runs in zoom regions)
flares.description: A suite of 40 zoom-in simulations targeting regions of varying overdensity during the Epoch of Reionization, enabling composite statistics representative of a (3.2 Gpc)^3 volume.

flamingo.name: FLAMINGO
aliases: Full-hydro Large-scale structure simulations with All-sky Mapping for the Interpretation of Next Generation Observations
flamingo.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, massive neutrinos
flamingo.volume: Up to (2.8 Gpc)^3 (multiple runs at different resolutions)
flamingo.mass_resolution: High-res: baryon ~1×10^8 M⊙ (DM ~5×10^8 M⊙); Mid-res: baryon ~1×10^9 M⊙ (DM ~5×10^9 M⊙)
flamingo.description: A suite of large-volume (up to 2.8 Gpc)^3 hydrodynamical simulations designed for next-generation large-scale structure surveys, including the effects of baryons and neutrinos.

colibre.name: COLIBRE
colibre.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
colibre.volume: Test volumes from (25 cMpc)^3 up to (400 cMpc)^3
colibre.mass_resolution: Highest res: baryon ~1×10^5 M⊙ (DM ~5×10^5 M⊙); Lowest res: baryon ~1×10^7 M⊙ (DM ~5×10^7 M⊙)
colibre.description: A suite of simulations spanning a range of volumes and resolutions, aiming to reproduce galaxy properties from high redshift to z=0 by calibrating feedback across scales.

camels.name: CAMELS
aliases: Cosmology and Astrophysics with MachinE Learning Simulations
camels.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback; gravity-only variants
camels.hydrodynamics: Moving-mesh MHD (AREPO) and meshless hydrodynamics (GIZMO); none for N-body-only runs
camels.subgrid_model: IllustrisTNG and SIMBA galaxy formation models with varied subgrid parameters; N-body only for DMO runs
camels.volume: (25 h^-1 Mpc)^3 per simulation (some extended to (50 h^-1 Mpc)^3 in later generations)
camels.mass_resolution: DM ~1×10^9 M⊙, gas ~2×10^8 M⊙ (for 25 h^-1 Mpc boxes, at fiducial resolution)
camels.description: A large suite (~4,000+) of small cosmological simulations (25 h^-1 Mpc boxes) varying cosmological parameters and subgrid physics, designed to train machine learning models and marginalize over baryonic effects.

quijote.name: Quijote Simulations
quijote.included_physics: gravity (dark matter only, some runs with massive neutrinos)
quijote.mass_resolution: Simulations span 256^3 to 1024^3 DM particles in 1 h^-1 Gpc (e.g. 512^3 gives DM ≈7×10^11 h^-1 M⊙ per particle; 1024^3 gives ≈9×10^10 h^-1 M⊙)
quijote.description: A massive suite of 44,100 N-body simulations (1 h^-1 Gpc boxes) exploring over 7,000 cosmologies, designed to quantify information content in large-scale structure and provide training data for emulators.

bluetides.name: BlueTides
bluetides.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment, UV background reionization
bluetides.description: A record-setting hydrodynamic simulation (2×7040^3 particles) run on the Blue Waters supercomputer, modeling the formation of galaxies and quasars from z=99 to z~8 in a 400 h^-1 Mpc volume.

frontier.name: Frontier Simulation
frontier.included_physics: gravity, magneto-hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN jet feedback
frontier.subgrid_model: Frontier AGN jet heating and feedback model
frontier.mass_resolution: DM ~1×10^9 M⊙; gas ~2×10^8 M⊙ (approximate for current runs)
frontier.description: A flagship cosmological hydrodynamical simulation run on the exascale Frontier supercomputer, covering ~10 billion light-years and including dark matter, gas, star formation and black hole physics for comparison with upcoming surveys.

sphinx.name: SPHINX
sphinx.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, radiative transfer, non-equilibrium cooling
sphinx.subgrid_model: SPHINX galaxy formation and reionization model
sphinx.volume: Boxes of 5–10 cMpc on a side
sphinx.mass_resolution: DM 2.5×10^5 M⊙ per particle; minimum cell size ~10 pc
sphinx.description: A suite of small-volume (5–10 cMpc) radiation-hydrodynamical simulations of the first billion years, resolving the multi-phase ISM and tracking ionizing radiation escape from thousands of early galaxies.

megatron.name: MEGATRON
megatron.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, radiative transfer, non-equilibrium chemistry, star formation, stellar feedback, Population III and II enrichment
megatron.subgrid_model: MEGATRON galaxy formation and ISM model (PRISM-based)
megatron.volume: Zoom-in on the Lagrangian region of a Milky Way-mass halo within a larger cosmological box
megatron.mass_resolution: DM ~1×10^5 M⊙; gas ~1×10^4 M⊙ (in highest-resolution regions)
megatron.end_redshift: z~1–2 (for Milky Way progenitor runs; some applications to z~8 dwarf regime)
megatron.description: A suite of high-resolution radiation-hydrodynamic zoom simulations of a Milky Way-mass environment from the epoch of Population III star formation to cosmic noon, with detailed non-equilibrium chemistry and multifrequency radiative transfer.

hestia.name: HESTIA
aliases: High-resolution Environmental Simulations of The Immediate Area
hestia.included_physics: gravity, magneto-hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback
hestia.volume: High-resolution region ~5 Mpc radius around the Local Group (embedded in a ~100 h^-1 Mpc constrained volume)
hestia.mass_resolution: DM 1.5×10^5 M⊙; gas 2.2×10^4 M⊙; Plummer-equivalent softening ~220 pc
hestia.description: A suite of constrained Local Group simulations producing realistic Milky Way and Andromeda analogues (and their satellites) embedded in a cosmographically accurate environment.

thesan.name: THESAN
thesan.included_physics: gravity, magneto-hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, radiative transfer, dust, chemical enrichment
thesan.subgrid_model: THESAN galaxy formation and reionization model (IllustrisTNG-based)
thesan.mass_resolution: DM 3.12×10^6 M⊙; gas 5.82×10^5 M⊙ (flagship THESAN-1 run)
thesan.description: A large-volume (95.5 cMpc)^3 radiation-MHD simulation suite of the Epoch of Reionization, extending the IllustrisTNG physics model with on-the-fly radiative transfer to produce a realistic reionization history and high-redshift galaxy population.

thesan_zoom.name: THESAN-ZOOM
thesan_zoom.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, radiative transfer, star formation, stellar feedback, dust, chemical enrichment
thesan_zoom.subgrid_model: THESAN-ZOOM multi-phase ISM and galaxy formation model
thesan_zoom.volume: Zoom-in regions around haloes (M_halo ~10^8–10^13 M⊙ at z=3) selected from the THESAN volume
thesan_zoom.mass_resolution: DM ~7×10^2 M⊙; gas ~1.4×10^2 M⊙ (17 comoving pc softening in fiducial runs)
thesan_zoom.description: A suite of ultra-high-resolution radiation-hydrodynamic zoom simulations of 14 high-redshift galaxies drawn from THESAN, resolving the ISM on parsec scales while preserving the large-scale reionization environment.

fable.name: FABLE
aliases: Feedback Acting on Baryons in Large-scale Environments
fable.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, AGN feedback, chemical enrichment
fable.volume: Calibration box ~ (40 cMpc)^3 plus zoom-in simulations of galaxy groups and clusters (M_200 ~10^13–10^15 M⊙)
fable.mass_resolution: Calibration run: gas ~1×10^6 M⊙, DM ~few ×10^6 M⊙; higher resolution in zoom-in halos (DM ~10^5–10^6 M⊙ in cluster cores)
fable.description: A simulation suite combining a (40 cMpc)^3 calibration box with zoom-in simulations of galaxy groups and clusters to model baryon content and feedback in massive halos using an improved Illustris-based model.

lyra.name: LYRA
lyra.included_physics: gravity, hydrodynamics, star formation, stellar feedback, supernova feedback, chemical enrichment
lyra.volume: Zoom-in on a ~2×10^9 M⊙ halo (selected from a larger volume or isolated setup)
lyra.mass_resolution: DM ≈2×10^1 M⊙; gas 4 M⊙ per cell (resolves individual supernova events)
lyra.description: An extreme-resolution dwarf galaxy zoom simulation resolving the ISM down to ~4 M⊙ gas elements and 10 K, forming individual stars and tracking their feedback to z=0.

cosmic_dawn.name: CoDa (Cosmic Dawn)
cosmic_dawn.included_physics: Gravity, Hydrodynamics, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, Radiative Transfer
cosmic_dawn.hydrodynamics: Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) with radiative transfer
cosmic_dawn.description: Fully coupled radiation-hydrodynamic simulations of the Epoch of Reionization with GPU-accelerated radiative transfer using RAMSES-CUDATON.

horizon_agn.name: Horizon-AGN
horizon_agn.included_physics: Gravity, Hydrodynamics, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Metal Enrichment
horizon_agn.description: A large-volume cosmological hydrodynamical simulation using AMR and AGN feedback to explore galaxy formation and evolution from high redshift to the local universe.

newhorizon.name: NewHorizon
newhorizon.included_physics: Gravity, Hydrodynamics, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Metal Enrichment
newhorizon.mass_resolution: DM ~1e6 M⊙; gas cell size down to ~34 pc
newhorizon.description: A high-resolution zoom-in simulation embedded in a larger cosmological box, focusing on detailed ISM structure and galaxy formation.

astrid.name: ASTRID
astrid.included_physics: Gravity, Hydrodynamics, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Reionization, Massive Neutrinos
astrid.description: A large cosmological SPH simulation focused on early galaxy formation, including physics for inhomogeneous reionization, baryon-dark matter streaming, and massive neutrinos.

lgalaxies.name: L-Galaxies
lgalaxies.included_physics: Gas Cooling, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Chemical Enrichment, Galaxy Mergers
lgalaxies.description: A semi-analytic model built on Millennium Simulation trees, modeling galaxy growth via baryonic processes and halo mergers.

sc_sam.name: Santa Cruz SAM
sc_sam.included_physics: Gas Cooling, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Environmental Effects, Chemical Evolution
sc_sam.description: A flexible SAM framework incorporating feedback, cooling, and environmental processes, applied to halo trees from Bolshoi and other N-body simulations.

shark.name: SHARK
shark.included_physics: Gas Cooling, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Reionization, Chemical Evolution
shark.description: A modern, open-source semi-analytic model applied to halo trees from SURFS, featuring modular implementations of key baryonic processes.

galform.name: GALFORM
galform.included_physics: Gas Cooling, Star Formation, Stellar Feedback, AGN Feedback, Photoionization Suppression, Chemical Evolution
galform.description: A longstanding SAM incorporating various baryonic processes and applied to large-volume N-body simulations such as Millennium and Planck-Millennium.
